div.p: SCHOTTISCHE, the German for “ Scottish,” a name given to a dance, der schottische Tanz, introduced into England about 1850. It was a form of polka, with two figures. The “ Highland Schottische ” is a lively dance resembling a fling. What is known as the “barn dance” was first known in America as the “ Military Schottische.”
